title: Establishes a clean air account and makes an appropriation therefor
summary: Establishes a clean air account and makes an appropriation therefor; specifies the manner in which such appropriation is to be utilized.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1766

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 12, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sens. PERKINS, ADAMS, DIAZ, DILAN, DUANE, HASSELL-THOMP-
         SON, KRUEGER, PARKER, SAMPSON, SERRANO, STEWART-COUSINS -- read  twice
         and ordered printed, and when printed to be committed to the Committee
         on Finance

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the state finance law, in relation to establishing a
         clean air account; and making an appropriation therefor

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Paragraph a of subdivision 2 of section 92-s of the state
    2  finance law, as added by chapter 610 of the laws of 1993, is amended  to
    3  read as follows:
    4    a. The comptroller shall establish the following separate and distinct
    5  accounts within the environmental protection fund:
    6    (i) solid waste account;
    7    (ii) parks, recreation and historic preservation account;
    8    (iii) open space account; [and]
    9    (iv) environmental protection transfer account[.]; AND
   10    (V) CLEAN AIR ACCOUNT.
   11    S  2.  Paragraph  (e)  of  subdivision  6 of section 92-s of the state
   12  finance law is relettered paragraph (f) and a new paragraph (e) is added
   13  to read as follows:
   14    (E) MONEYS FROM THE CLEAN AIR ACCOUNT SHALL BE AVAILABLE, PURSUANT  TO
   15  APPROPRIATION,  FOR  CLEAN AIR ACCOUNT PROJECTS ACCORDING TO THE FOLLOW-
   16  ING:
   17    (I) THIRTY-FIVE MILLION DOLLARS TO UPGRADE SCHOOL BOILERS. THE COMMIS-
   18  SIONER OF EDUCATION SHALL ESTABLISH A PROCEDURE TO DETERMINE THE PRIORI-
   19  TY OF WHICH SCHOOL BOILERS SHALL BE REPLACED;
   20    (II) FIVE MILLION DOLLARS FOR GRANTS TO SCHOOLS IN CLEAN  AIR  NON-AT-
   21  TAINMENT AREAS TO PAY FOR THE INCREASED COST OF ULTRA LOW SULFUR DIESEL;
   22  AND

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06895-01-1

       S. 1766                             2

    1    (III)  TEN  MILLION  DOLLARS TO FUND THE INITIAL COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH
    2  CONVERSION TO BOILERS OR FURNACES THAT USE BIO-FUEL.
    3    S 3. The sum of fifty million dollars ($50,000,000), or so much there-
    4  of  as  may  be  necessary,  is hereby appropriated to the department of
    5  environmental conservation out of any moneys in the  state  treasury  in
    6  the  general  fund to the credit of the clean air account, not otherwise
    7  appropriated, and made immediately available, for the purpose of  carry-
    8  ing  out the provisions of this act. Such moneys shall be payable on the
    9  audit and warrant of the comptroller on vouchers certified  or  approved
   10  by  the  commissioner of the department of environmental conservation in
   11  the manner prescribed by law.
   12    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.
